name: src/custom-operators.js
src/execute-js-func.js
getSenderIdentifier
description:
Determines the identifier for the current process (i.e. the thing we can use
to route messages to it)

return.description: An object with either a `guestInstanceId` or a `browserWindowId`

name: getReplyMethod
description: Determines a way to send a reply back from an incoming eval request.

params.name: request
params.description: An object returned from {getSenderIdentifier}

return.description:
A function that act like ipc.send, but to a
                           particular process.

name: listenToIpc
description: Turns an IPC channel into an Observable

params.name: channel
params.description: The IPC channel to listen to via `ipc.on`

return.description: An Observable which sends IPC args via `onNext`

name: getSendMethod
description:
Returns a method that will act like `ipc.send` depending on the parameter
passed to it, so you don't have to check for `webContents`.

params.name: windowOrWebView
params.description: The renderer to send to.

return.description:
A function that behaves like
                                                   `ipc.send`.

name: listenerForId
description:
This method creates an Observable Promise that represents a future response
to a remoted call. It filters on ID, then cancels itself once either a
response is returned, or it times out.

params.name: windowOrWebView
params.description: A renderer process

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the sent request

params.name: timeout
params.description: The timeout in milliseconds

return.description:
An Observable Promise
                                                   representing the result, or
                                                   an OnError with the error.

name: findTargetFromParentInfo
description:
Given the parentInfo returned from {getSenderIdentifier}, returns the actual
BrowserWindow or WebContents that it represents.

params.name: parentInfo
params.description: The renderer process identifying info.

return.description: An actual Renderer Process object.

name: setParentInformation
description:
Configures a child renderer process who to send replies to. Call this method
when you want child windows to be able to use their parent as an implicit
target.

params.name: windowOrWebView
params.description: The child to configure

name: remoteEvalObservable
description: Evaluates a string `eval`-style in a remote renderer process.

params.name: windowOrWebView
params.description: The child to execute code in.

params.name: str
params.description: The code to execute.

params.name: timeout
params.description: The timeout in milliseconds

return.description:
The result of the evaluation.
                                                 Must be JSON-serializable.

name: remoteEval
description: Evaluates a string `eval`-style in a remote renderer process.

params.name: windowOrWebView
params.description: The child to execute code in.

params.name: str
params.description: The code to execute.

params.name: timeout
params.description: The timeout in milliseconds

return.description:
The result of the evaluation.
                                              Must be JSON-serializable.

name: executeJavaScriptMethodObservable
description:
Evaluates a JavaScript method on a remote object and returns the result. this
method can be used to either execute Functions in remote renderers, or return
values from objects. For example:

let userAgent = await executeJavaScriptMethod(wnd, 'navigator.userAgent');

executeJavaScriptMethod will also be smart enough to recognize when methods
themselves return Promises and await them:

let fetchResult = await executeJavaScriptMethod('window.fetchHtml', 'https://google.com');

params.name: windowOrWebView
params.description:
The child to execute code
                                                 in. If this parameter is
                                                 null, this will reference
                                                 the browser process.

params.name: timeout
params.description: Timeout in milliseconds

params.name: pathToObject
params.description:
A path to the object to execute, in dotted
                                 form i.e. 'document.querySelector'.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments to pass to the method

return.description:
The result of evaluating the method or
                                    property. Must be JSON serializable.

name: executeJavaScriptMethod
description:
Evaluates a JavaScript method on a remote object and returns the result. this
method can be used to either execute Functions in remote renderers, or return
values from objects. For example:

let userAgent = await executeJavaScriptMethod(wnd, 'navigator.userAgent');

executeJavaScriptMethod will also be smart enough to recognize when methods
themselves return Promises and await them:

let fetchResult = await executeJavaScriptMethod('window.fetchHtml', 'https://google.com');

params.name: windowOrWebView
params.description:
The child to execute code
                                                 in. If this parameter is
                                                 null, this will reference
                                                 the browser process.

params.name: pathToObject
params.description:
A path to the object to execute, in dotted
                                 form i.e. 'document.querySelector'.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments to pass to the method

return.description:
The result of evaluating the method or
                                 property. Must be JSON serializable.

name: createProxyForRemote
description:
Creates an object that is a representation of the remote process's 'window'
object that allows you to remotely invoke methods.

params.name: windowOrWebView
params.description:
The child to execute code
                                                 in. If this parameter is
                                                 null, this will reference
                                                 the browser process.

return.description:
A Proxy object that will invoke methods remotely.
                     Similar to {executeJavaScriptMethod}, methods will return
                     a Promise even if the target method returns a normal
                     value.

name: objectAndParentGivenPath
description:
Walks the global object hierarchy to resolve the actual object that a dotted
object path refers to.

params.name: path
params.description:
A path to the object to execute, in dotted
                       form i.e. 'document.querySelector'.

return.description:
Returns the actual method object and its parent,
                             usually a Function and its `this` parameter, as
                             `[parent, obj]`

name: evalRemoteMethod
description:
Given an object path and arguments, actually invokes the method  and returns
the result. This method is run on the target side (i.e. not the one doing
the invoking). This method tries to figure out the return value of an object
and do the right thing, including awaiting Promises to get their values.

params.name: path
params.description:
A path to the object to execute, in dotted
                       form i.e. 'document.querySelector'.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments to pass to the method

return.description: The result of evaluating path(...args)

name: initializeEvalHandler
description:
Initializes the IPC listener that {executeJavaScriptMethod} will send IPC
messages to. You need to call this method in any process that you want to
execute remote methods on.

return.description:
An object that you can call `dispose` on to clean up
                       the listener early. Usually not necessary.

name: RecursiveProxyHandler
description:
RecursiveProxyHandler is a ES6 Proxy Handler object that intercepts method
invocations and returns the full object that was invoked. So this means, if you
get a proxy, then execute `foo.bar.bamf(5)`, you'll recieve a callback with
the parameters "foo.bar.bamf" as a string, and [5].

name: constructor
description: Creates a new RecursiveProxyHandler. Don't use this, use `create`

name: create
description: Creates an ES6 Proxy which is handled by RecursiveProxyHandler.

params.name: name
params.description: The root object name

params.name: methodHandler
params.description:
The Function to handle method invocations -
                                  this method will receive an Array<String> of
                                  object names which will point to the Function
                                  on the Proxy being invoked.

params.name: overrides
params.description:
An optional object that lets you directly
                                  include functions on the top-level object, its
                                  keys are key names for the property, and
                                  the values are what the key on the property
                                  should return.

return.description:
An ES6 Proxy object that uses
                                  RecursiveProxyHandler.

name: get
description: The {get} ES6 Proxy handler.

name: apply
description: The {apply} ES6 Proxy handler.

name: getOrCreateProxyHandler
description: Creates a proxy for a returned `get` call.

params.name: name
params.description: The property name

name: replaceGetterWithName
description:
Because we don't support directly getting values by-name, we convert any
call of the form "getXyz" into a call for the value 'xyz'

return.description: The name of the actual method or property to evaluate.

name: src/index.js
src/remote-ajax.js
fetchFileOrUrl
description: Fetches a path as either a file path or a HTTP URL.

params.name: pathOrUrl
params.description: Either an HTTP URL or a file path.

return.description: The contents as a UTF-8 decoded string.

name: downloadFileOrUrl
description: Downloads a path as either a file path or a HTTP URL to a specific place

params.name: pathOrUrl
params.description: Either an HTTP URL or a file path.

return.description: The contents as a UTF-8 decoded string.

name: src/renderer-require-preload.js
src/renderer-require.js
rendererRequireDirect

params.name: modulePath
params.description: The path of the module to include.

return.description:
Returns an Object with a `module` which is a Proxy
                             object, and a `dispose` method that will clean up
                             the window.

name: requireTaskPool
description:
requires a module in BrowserWindows that are created/destroyed as-needed, and
returns a Proxy object that will secretly marshal invocations to other processes
and marshal back the result. This is the cool method in this library.

Note that since the global context is created / destroyed, you *cannot* rely
on module state (i.e. global variables) to be consistent

params.name: modulePath
params.description:
The path to the module. You may have to
                                  `require.resolve` it.

params.name: maxConcurrency
params.description:
The maximum number of concurrent processes
                                  to run. Defaults to 4.

return.description: An ES6 Proxy object representing the module.

name: RendererTaskpoolItem
description:
This class implements the scheduling logic for queuing and dispatching method
invocations to various background windows. It is complicated. But in like,
a cool way.
